Package software.leonov.common.io

Class FileFilters

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.common.io.FileFilters
  • public final class FileFilters
extends Object
    Static utility methods pertaining to FileFilters.

    Warning: The java.io.File facility should be considered deprecated. Java 7+ users are highly encouraged to use java.nio.file.Path operations introduced in JDK 7 as part of the The Java NIO.2 File System. See Fs for more information.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    PatternFilenameFilter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static FileFilter alwaysFalse()
      Returns a file filter that always evaluates to false.
      static FileFilter alwaysTrue()
      Returns a file filter that always evaluates to true.
      static FileFilter and​(FileFilter... filters)
      Returns a file filter that evaluates to true if all of the specified file filters evaluate to true.
      static FileFilter forFilenameFilter​(FilenameFilter filter)
      Adapts a FilenameFilter to the FileFilter interface.
      static FileFilter forPredicate​(Predicate<File> predicate)
      Adapts a Predicate to the FileFilter interface.
      static FileFilter isDirectory()
      Returns a FileFilter which determines if the specified File is a directory.
      static FileFilter isFile()
      Returns a FileFilter which determines if the specified File is a normal file.
      static FileFilter not​(FileFilter filter)
      Returns a file filter that evaluates to true if the given file filter evaluates to false.
      static FileFilter or​(FileFilter... filters)
      Returns a file filter that evaluates to true if any of the specified file filters evaluate to true.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Returns a file filter that always evaluates to true.

      • and

        public static FileFilter and​(FileFilter... filters)
        Returns a file filter that evaluates to true if all of the specified file filters evaluate to true.
        Parameters:
        filters - the specified file filters
        Returns:
        a file filter that evaluates to true if all of the specified file filters evaluate to true
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no filters are given

      • forFilenameFilter

        public static FileFilter forFilenameFilter​(FilenameFilter filter)
        Adapts a FilenameFilter to the FileFilter interface.
        Parameters:
        filter - the specified FilenameFilter
        Returns:
        a new FileFilter which mimics the behavior of the specified FilenameFilter

      • forPredicate

        public static FileFilter forPredicate​(Predicate<File> predicate)
        Adapts a Predicate to the FileFilter interface.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the specified Predicate
        Returns:
        a new FileFilter which mimics the behavior of the specified Predicate

      • isDirectory

        public static FileFilter isDirectory()
        Returns a FileFilter which determines if the specified File is a directory.
        Returns:
        a FileFilter which determines if the specified File is a directory

      • isFile

        public static FileFilter isFile()
        Returns a FileFilter which determines if the specified File is a normal file. A file is normal if it is not a directory and, in addition, satisfies other system-dependent criteria.
        Returns:
        a FileFilter which determines if the specified File is a normal file

      • not

        public static FileFilter not​(FileFilter filter)
        Returns a file filter that evaluates to true if the given file filter evaluates to false.
        Parameters:
        filter - the given file filter
        Returns:
        a file filter that evaluates to true if the given file filter evaluates to false

      • or

        public static FileFilter or​(FileFilter... filters)
        Returns a file filter that evaluates to true if any of the specified file filters evaluate to true.
        Parameters:
        filters - the specified file filters
        Returns:
        a file filter that evaluates to true if any of the specified file filters evaluate to true
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no filters are given
